Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2011 03:04PM Amy_33 wrote: I did the diagnostic mammo and an ultrasound, but both were negative. It's been a month since the tests and the lump is still there. It doesn't appear any bigger, but it stillÂ worried me so I saw a surgeon yesterday. He felt the lump and decided that due to my family history I should have the lump removed. (My mom died of breast CA 8 years ago). To say I am freaked out is an understatement. I understand your fear and anxiety. If I can help in anyway, even if it's just to vent, I'd be happy to! Good luck on your tests!!!
Posts.Title: DX Mammo Scheduled, Trying to Stay Calm Cindy_B Cindy_B

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2011 03:28AM Amy_33 wrote: Hi Amanda. I'm 33 and just underwent a biopsy myself yesterday. Now I am patiently (or not so patiently) waiting for the results. First, I want to say great job for getting it checked out! Especially without a family history. A lot of women tend to brush it off, so way to be proactive! I'm not sure about the ultrasound colors. I know when I had my ultrasound those colors showed up too, but they were unable to find the lump on US. Or on my mammogram for that matter. The little bugger could only be felt, not seen. I understand your worry. Are they doing a needle biopsy or excisional biopsy? I've been told by the AMAZING women on this site that over 80% of breast biopsies are negative, if that makes you feel any better. Good luck with everything! If I can help in anyway, please let me know!
Posts.Title: New here! Lump found and waiting 4 biopsy jesusluvsu2005 Amy_33

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2011 01:30AM Amy_33 wrote: Hey Amanda. How are you doing today? Any news on when you are scheduled for a biopsy? Sending lots of prayer and good wishes your way!! Amy
